bug.short_desc: imapd signaled to death + corrupt inbox on Solaris

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
We are running Cyrus 2.2.10 on Solaris 8 using saslauthd and LDAP authentication.
Since we upgraded from Cyrus 2.1.x to Cyrus 2.2.10 it happens frequently that users inboxes get corrupted and clients cannot connect.
The entry in the logfile is:
Jan 26 12:46:13 mailsrv master[5565]: [ID 392559 local6.debug] about to exec /opt/adnmail/cyrus/bin/imapd Jan 26 12:46:13 mailsrv imap[5565]: [ID 518349 local6.debug] executed Jan 26 12:46:13 mailsrv imap[5565]: [ID 921384 local6.debug] accepted connection Jan 26 12:46:14 mailsrv imap[5565]: [ID 277583 local6.notice] login: hostname.domain.tld [192.168.5.186] kauf plaintext User logged in Jan 26 12:46:14 mailsrv imap[5565]: [ID 677757 local6.debug] seen_db: user kauf opened /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap/user/k/kauf.seen Jan 26 12:46:14 mailsrv imap[5565]: [ID 736213 local6.debug] open: user kauf opened INBOX Jan 26 12:46:18 mailsrv master[26161]: [ID 970914 local6.error] process 5565 exited, signaled to death by 11 Jan 26 12:46:18 mailsrv master[26161]: [ID 621917 local6.debug] service imap pid 5565 in BUSY state: terminated abnormally
A pstack on the imapd core file gives (maybe one can get more information but I'm not a debugger guru):
root@mailsrv:~> pstack imapd-kauf-core core 'imapd-kauf-core' of 5565: imapd 0003beb8 mailbox_expunge (10ec8c, 0, 0, 118a20, 20, 538fc) + 47c 00022d74 cmd_expunge (11f800, 0, 11f800, 1ff, 10ec8c, 6e676500) + 60 0001ba18 cmdloop (11d430, a, eb800, 11d430, 108d04, 118b71) + c18 0001aa80 service_main (108c00, 1c2, 1e0, 108c00, 108c00, eb400) + 320 000190e0 main (0, 0, 1, 1, 6, 108ce8) + 924 00018438 _start (0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0) + 108
The Cyrus IMAP server runs on a Enterprise 450, 1GB RAM, 2x300 MHz CPU with about 100 IMAP Users. Operating system is Solaris 8.
# uname -a SunOS mailsrv 5.8 Generic_117350-02 sun4u sparc SUNW,Ultra-4
Compilation -----------
PATH=/opt/studio/8/bin:$PATH CC=cc CFLAGS=-O CXX=CC CXXFLAGS=-O2 CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/adnmail/db/include -I/opt/adnmail/openssl/include -I/opt/adnmail/cyrus/include -I/opt/adnmail/openldap/include" LDFLAGS="-R/opt/adnmail/db/lib -R/opt/adnmail/openssl/lib -R/opt/adnmail/cyrus/lib -R/opt/adnmail/openldap/lib -R/opt/adnmail/perl/lib -L/opt/adnmail/db/lib -L/opt/adnmail/openssl/lib -L/opt/adnmail/cyrus/lib -L/opt/adnmail/openldap/lib"
unset LD_LIBRARY_PATH
export PATH CC CFLAGS CXX CXXFLAGS LDFLAGS CPPFLAGS
gtar -xvpzf cyrus-sasl-2.1.20.tar.gz cd cyrus-sasl-2.1.20 ./configure --prefix=/opt/adnmail/cyrus \ --with-dbpath=/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/etc/sasldb2 \ --sysconfdir=/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/etc \ --with-dblib=berkeley \ --with-bdb-libdir=/opt/adnmail/db/lib \ --with-bdb-incdir=/opt/adnmail/db/include \ --with-openssl=/opt/adnmail/openssl \ --with-ldap=/opt/adnmail/openldap \ --with-plugindir=/opt/adnmail/cyrus/lib/sasl2 \ --with-saslauthd=/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap/socket \ --with-des=/opt/adnmail/openssl \ --with-ldap=/opt/adnmail/openldap \ --with-pam \ --enable-anon \ --enable-login \ --enable-shared \ --enable-static \ --disable-gssapi \ --disable-kerb5 /share/app/gnu/bin/make /share/app/gnu/bin/make install cd ..
cd cyrus-imapd-2.2.10 ./configure --prefix=/opt/adnmail/cyrus \ --with-auth=unix \ --with-cyrus-prefix=/opt/adnmail/cyrus \ --with-dbdir=/opt/adnmail/db \ --with-openssl=/opt/adnmail/openssl \ --with-sasl=/opt/adnmail/cyrus \ --with-perl=/opt/adnmail/perl/bin/perl \ --sysconfdir=/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/etc \ --with-statedir=/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/socket \ --disable-krb4 \ --disable-cram \ --disable-gssapi \ --without-krb
/share/app/gnu/bin/make /share/app/gnu/bin/make install
Configuration: cyrus.conf -------------------------
START { recover cmd="ctl_cyrusdb -r"
}
SERVICES { listen="mailsrv.domain.tld:imap" prefork=0 imaps cmd="imapd -s" listen="mailsrv.domain.tld:imaps" prefork=0 sieve cmd="timsieved" listen="mailsrv.domain.tld:sieve" prefork=0
lmtp cmd="lmtpd" listen="mailsrv.domain.tld:lmtp" prefork=0 lmtpunix cmd="lmtpd" listen="/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap/socket/lmtp" prefork=0
listen="/var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap/socket/notify" proto="udp" prefork=1 }
EVENTS { checkpoint cmd="ctl_cyrusdb -c" period=30
delprune cmd="ctl_deliver -E 3" at=0400
tlsprune cmd="tls_prune" at=0400 }
Configuration: imapd.conf -------------------------
configdirectory: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap sievedir: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/sieve lmtpsocket: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/imap/socket/lmtp
tls_cert_file: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/certs/imap.pem tls_key_file: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/certs/imap.key tls_ca_file: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/certs/ca-cert.pem
defaultpartition: default partition-default: /data/mail1 partition-share: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/mail
servername: mailsrv.domain.tld admins: cyrus unixhierarchysep: yes altnamespace: yes sendmail: /opt/adnmail/postfix/sbin/sendmail logtimestamps: yes defaultacl: anyone lrsp duplicatesuppression: yes
allowplaintext: yes sasl_pwcheck_method: saslauthd sasl_mech_list: PLAIN sasl_sasldb_path: /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/etc/sasldb2
Configuration: saslauthd.conf -----------------------------
ldap_servers: ldap://192.168.5.216/ ldap://192.168.1.216/ ldap://192.168.4.216/ ldap://192.168.6.216/ ldap_search_base: ou=people,o=domain,c=ch ldap_bind_dn: cn=proxyagent,ou=special_users,o=domain,c=ch ldap_password: myPassWord ldap_scope: one ldap_uidattr: uid ldap_filter_mode: yes ldap_filter: uid=%u
Server startup --------------
/opt/adnmail/cyrus/sbin/saslauthd -a ldap /opt/adnmail/cyrus/bin/master

These crashes are caused because cyrus runs out of file descriptors:
Feb 18 14:37:51 mailsrv lmtpunix[25178]: [ID 136705 local6.error] IOERROR: opening /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/mail/dev/a2k-dev/cyrus.cache: Too many open files Feb 18 14:37:51 mailsrv lmtpunix[25178]: [ID 860734 local6.debug] verify_user(dev.a2k-dev) failed: System I/O error Feb 18 14:38:03 mailsrv imap[546]: [ID 299345 local6.debug] SQUAT failed to open index file Feb 18 14:38:03 mailsrv imap[546]: [ID 418793 local6.debug] SQUAT failed Feb 18 14:38:30 mailsrv master[19603]: [ID 970914 local6.error] process 6771 exited, signaled to death by 11 Feb 18 14:38:30 mailsv master[19603]: [ID 621917 local6.debug] service imaps pid 6771 in BUSY state: terminated abnormally Feb 18 14:38:43 mailsrv master[19603]: [ID 970914 local6.error] process 1326 exited, signaled to death by 11
A couple of days ago I increased the default file descriptor settings in /etc/system from default
set rlim_fd_cur=1024 set rlim_fd_max=4096
to
set rlim_fd_cur=32768 set rlim_fd_max=65536
But recently Cyrus ran out again of file descriptors.
Tuning guides tell that it is dangerous to increase these default values:
http://docs.sun.com/source/817-6255/SystemTuning.html http://www.princeton.edu/~psg/unix/solaris/troubleshoot/filedesc.html
We have about 100 concurrent imap users and some of them have more than 10000 mails in a folder. Postfix runs on the same host and delivers the mails through a lmtp socket.
Could it possibly be that Cyrus may not close correctly every file after accessing it and therefore runs out of file descriptors? Or what is the recommended setting?

If you can still reproduce this, use of lsof should show you what's leaking file descriptors. There may be a bug, I fixed one in the last few days, but unless you're using nntpd for posting it wouldn't have affected you. I'd bet there are others.

While a process produced "too many open files" warnings I did a lsof of that process. Strange ... the number of open files seems to be far below the limit. Also other processes at that time did not have suspicious many open files.
Mar 3 11:01:04 ducati lmtpunix[5738]: IOERROR: opening /var/spool/adnmail/cyrus/mail/dev/sauber-dev/cyrus.cache: Too many open files Mar 3 11:01:05 ducati lmtpunix[5738]: IOERROR: opening /data/mail1/user/hacke/cyrus.cache: Too many open files Mar 3 11:04:24 ducati master[8559]: process 7050 exited, signaled to death by 11
root@ducati:~> lsof -p 5738 |wc -l 288
See full list of open files by process lmtpd with PID 5738 in the attachment.
root@ducati:~> lsof |grep ldap_cache_door |wc -l 1093
root@ducati:~> lsof |wc -l 17466
root@ducati:~> cat /etc/system set rlim_fd_max=4096 set rlim_fd_cur=1024
In the cyrus startup script I set
ulimit -n 65536
So it isn't really the file descriptor limit that caused this error. I decreased the values in /etc/system vrom 231 to the default value because the system became unstable.
Regards, Bernd

/etc/.ldap_cache_door (door to ldap_cachemgr[434])

the ldap cache door fds are clearly being leaked. However, this isn't something we provide, so if it's being leaked either it's a system problem, or some API which expects us to init and finalize it is being inited repeatedly but not finalized. Do you have the ability to attach with gdb and get a backtrace from when ldap_cache_door is opened? (You may need to break in open, and check each one until you get one opening the door, then get a backtrace)
I installed the latest recommended patch cluster and waited again. Did not help. There are zillions of /etc/.ldap_cache_door open in a lmtpd process. Will open case at Sun.
